author: Special Correspondent
text:
To be held in two batches in Tiruchi

The Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India, the National Implementing and Monitoring Agency for Training (NIMAT), will conduct a free entrepreneurship awareness camp in Tiruchi from January 11 to 13.

The camp is organised in association the National Institute of Technology and the Tiruchi District Tiny and Small Scale Industries Association (TIDITSSIA).

The camp will be held in two batches and the camp for the first batch will be held from January 11 at the S.S.K. Polytechnic College at Poolangulathupatti in Tiruchi.

Men and women aged above 18 and interested in starting new business ventures were eligible to attend the programme.

Candidates will be exposed to various aspects on how to start small business units and schemes implemented by the State and Union governments.

Forty persons would be admitted to the camp on first-come first-serve basis. Resource persons from various government organisations, successful entrepreneurs, and industrialists will handle the session.

N. Kanagasabapathy, president, TIDITSSIA, and R. Murugesan, associate professor, National Institute of Technology, are the coordinators of the camp.

Interested persons are required to register their name between 10 a.m. and 5 p.m. by appearing in person at the office of the TIDITSSIA at Ariyamangalam before January 9, S. Punniyamoorthy, Secretary, TIDITSSIA, said in a release.

For details, contact the TIDITSSIA office by dialling 0431-2440119/2440114 or email to tiditssiatry@gmail. com or tiditssiatry@yahoo.com
title: Entrepreneurship camp from January 11 to 13
